div1.head: Photograph of the room in which Clara Louise Maass died and Jesse W. Lazear was presumably bitten by an infected mosquito, Las Animas Hospital, Havana, Cuba, 1940
div1.p:
#35 Las Animas Hospital (Salle Guiteras)
Right hand corner of the little 8 bed ward in which
Dr Lazear presumably was bitten by a mosquito
note the cardboard (temporary) sign in his honor
over the bed. It errs in the spelling of his
name “James Lazear”! , Also the date & site
of his death. It will be replaced by a
bronze sign someday (MANÁNA!!!)
In the left of this room (see next photo) miss
Maass (the American nurse) died of
experimental yellow fever I have a large
photo of that corner also.

In de Salle Guiteras
the YF ward
Las Animas Hosp
note the memorial plaque to Dr. Lazear
which was on the wall for some years
It was a “temporary plaque” but was only
replaced very recently. (1948)
The plaque gave his name as James Lazear
& also gave the wrong date (28 Sept)
instead of Sept 25
I asked them to correct these errors
& they did.
